author: jessepollak
content: Alongside the regular gas that the transaction pays, with 4844 there is a new "data gas" that is a separate market and paid per byte. So the submitter would pay both.

author: domotheus
content: yeah but that's burned, i'm wondering about the mechanism for tipping the block builder when there's no `max_priority_fee_per_data_gas`. But rereading stuff Im pretty sure the answer to my question is yes

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> tips are purely a negotiation between the sender and the builder. So the tx sender should choose whatever value they think will make the builder include their transaction. Rationally, this is the marginal amount by which the probability of the block being orphaned increased. So yes, we should expect the tip to be a bit higher because larger blocks have a higher probability of being orphaned
